SENT.plain: A boy with bilateral colobomas, preauricular pits, and developmental delay had a 46,XY,22q+ karyotype
The abnormality of 22q was interpreted as a de novo tandem duplication of 22q11.1----q11.2
Although no anal abnormality was identified, his manifestations are otherwise consistent with those of the cat-eye syndrome
Blood marker results and the levels of galactosidase-2, galactosidase-B and arylsulfatase-A, which are known to be coded on 22q, are normal
